summary_comment: Professor Horn is widely praised for his exceptional teaching, evident in his passion for the subject matter and genuine care for his students. His classes are described as engaging and manageable, featuring minimal testing and a single paper. Students consistently recommend his classes and highlight his availability and willingness to assist with any issues or concerns.
summary_comment_short: Professor Horn is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and passion for his subject, making his classes engaging and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his willingness to help and his approachable nature, recommending his classes enthusiastically.

Ratings.comment: Professor Horn was definitely my favorite professor of this semester! He cares so much about his students and is passionate about what he is teaching. I highly recommend taking any of his class but especially this one because it is very interesting and there are only two tests and one paper. Also go to his office hours if you need help!

Professor David Horn was a pleasure to have as a teacher. David has a true passion for teaching and cares a lot about the subject he is teaching. There was only 1 Midterm, 1 Five Page Paper, and 1 Final in his class. Those were the only assignments, but the reading were very long and dry. Lucky, you do not really need to read the books to do well!

Dr.Horn is FANTASTIC!  He is a wonderful professor, terribly helpful and more than open to helping students with ANY issue or concerns they have regarding the class material/university life.  Also his socks were the highlight of my day...check them out for sure!  Do the work and you will succeed.

Dr. Horn is amazing at everything. Disregard anything on here about him being hard or awful, as those comments are about someone else. Also, make sure you check out his socks. Cause they're flipping fabulous.

BEST professor I've EVER had, taken four of his classes and LOVED all of them. Class is always stimulating - go and you will do well. Very willing to meet outside of class & average amount of work. He is an inspiring, intelligent professor. Our discussions are always interesting, Dr. Horn makes going to class enjoyable. TAKE HIS CLASS!
Everything everyone else said. Love him.

Absolutely fantastic man and teacher. One can tweak their essays to a good grade if you use the course material intelligently. He's very sympathetic to student's needs and a down-to-earth yet brilliant anthropologist. The best OSU professor I've ever dealt with with no exaggeration.

Dr. Horn is a great professor. His discussion groups are very interesting and fun. He is willing to acknowledge if he's assigned a lot in a certain week, too. Very helpful, I would highly recommend taking his class.

He's a great lecturer. One of the better ones for sure. He's really interested in what he's teaching. He's funny, and likes to make a lot of sex jokes. Most of the time you don't have to fight to keep your eyes open. I definately recommend him.

summary_comment: Professor Duke Schultz, known as Kelly, is highly regarded for her passion and depth of knowledge in her lectures, effectively encouraging critical thinking and discussion among students. While some noted her grading can be challenging, many praised her availability during office hours and recitations, where she clarified complex material and provided valuable insights. Her approachability and friendliness contribute to an engaging learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Duke Schultz, known as Kelly, is highly regarded for her passion and depth of knowledge in her lectures, which challenge students to re-examine their assumptions and engage in meaningful discussions. She is described as approachable and supportive, particularly during office hours and recitations, where she clarifies complex material and encourages active participation.

Ratings.comment: I didn't expect to enjoy this class (basically a lit requirement class looking at religious texts), but Kelly really forced us to reexamine some things I take for granted and she always had interesting debates for us to discuss. Definitely go to her office hours- she knows her stuff and it's fun to chat about religion with her.

Kelly was okay for the time I had her. Since she was prego Idk that she was on her A game as much. Her recitation was a little boring, seems like the topics discussed in the actual lecture were more interesting topics. Overall nice lady would probably take her again, she was much more relaxed than the other TA Conrad who can be a little out there.
Kellye did a great job making space for class discussions, and getting everyone to think about and understand other's positions.

She was passionate about the material she was teaching and was eager to make sure the students really understood the topics we discussed. She also prompted deeper thinking by providing thoughtful questions to ponder.
Kelly is a tough grader but if you ask questions she is willing to answer them during recitation. It was hard getting used to her grading

I don't know how I would have done in this class if it wasn't for Kelly's recitations. The lecturer (professor) was often unclear and sometimes gave us wrong information (according the the bookInternet). Kelly always clarified and fixed any wrong info from lecture, making it approachable and understandable. She's very helpful and knowledgable.

Kelly was very approachable and always available if you needed extra help during office hours or after class. She's super friendly and always made sure to keep class engaged in discussion and participation. Overall, great class!

Kelly was really nice and friendly. A lot of the discussion is participation based, so sometimes it's hard when people don't talk. She always answered any of our questions and made sure that we knew what was going to be on exams.

I would recommend this class in a heartbeat. I developed a professional portfolio that I could easily expand in the future. Kelly was very helpful whenever I had questions & would change the syllabus if the work load was too heavy. Assignments were very reasonable & very helpful - each had a purpose and a learning goal. Great class, great teacher.

Kelly is VERY flexible with student schedules and takes time to make sure that her students succeed! At first, the assignments were overwhelming, but as the semester continued, they became easier. Come to class ready to discuss material from the weekly readings. As long as she can see that you put in the time on your assignments, you will succeed!

Kelly was very helpful and tests your time management skills. Lots of work but it is worth it if you wish to become a better writer. Classes are discussion based which is great because you get familiar with your classmates. Overall she makes the class interesting and I am glad I took her class.
Very good professor. I would take the class again and recommend it.

A lot of assignments and reading, but usually not boring. Discussion based so it is very interactive. Class is not mandatory but it is worth it to show up. No exams, which is expected for a writing course. A lot of the time assignments are due on Saturday night, not long things but things nonetheless.

Kelly really understands students and is very flexible. She is willing  to work with students in order to see them succeed. No textbook or exams. There are a lot of assignments but if you do the work and she can see that you put in a lot of effort you will do well on them and in the class. Come   to class ready to actively participate everyday!

No textbooks- the readings/videos are all online. A lot of work, but if you do the work you will be fine. Kelly is very helpful, and makes a dry topic like religion interesting. The class is mostly discussion/ writing. I've learned a lot from Kelly and recommend taking her class.

I really learned a lot from Kelly. Even though I wasn't that interested in the class to begin with, she made it a class I looked forward to attending. You won't get by without putting in the work, but if you do the class is easy to do well in! Kelly is super helpful and passionate about what she teaches.
Kelly is a great instructor. Even when the course materials weren't interesting to me, she found a way to make the class worth going to. Do the work and you will be fine.

Kelly was very helpful and always answered any questions I had about my papers, class readings, etc. She is clearly passionate about teaching. Overall, the class wasn't the easiest I've taken but if you do the work you should have no problems.

First of all, she is very helpful and passionate in teaching. Discussions in class are very interesting. She makes you to think out of box. But you really have to put effort in the class. I would not say her class is easy but definitely recommend to take her class. Very interesting.
She is really nice. As an international student in the class, she provide a lot help for me. Choose her class~
Incredible, helpful teacher. One of the best

Kelly was a great teacher for this course. Made you think outside your comfort zone which generated a lot of class discussion. The class was not difficult. Do the readings, participate, and ask questions.
Class was well taught and very enjoyable, was definitely a good elective class, and was very eye opening
Great instructor, always willing to help and wants to make sure students understand and appreciate material.
She is a great TA and is very helpful. his is a wonderful class to take.
She is very helpful with any questions you have about the information learnt. She is prompt with emails. During recitation, she offers a different perspective of the subject than the professor does.
She is great! Very helpful and can work with you after class if you need help!
Friendly and willing to help.

summary_comment: Professor Bhadra is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, with lectures consistently described as engaging and fascinating. Her grading is noted for fairness, and she is known to be readily available to assist students, making her a highly recommended instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bhadra is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, making lectures engaging and ensuring fair grading. Students consistently praise her willingness to assist and recommend her classes enthusiastically.

Ratings.comment: The BEST professor I have ever had. Lecture was always incredibly interesting and grading was very fair. I really loved this class and the professor was always willing to help. Would really recommend taking a class from her!!

summary_comment: Professor Brenn is generally seen as a likable instructor who finds ways to make lectures engaging, though his disorganization is a significant issue. Students frequently complain about missing assignments, unposted readings, and delayed responses to emails, leading to frustration with the class structure. Overall, while some find the subject matter interesting, the lack of consistent preparation and communication makes the experience suboptimal.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brenn is generally considered a pleasant instructor whose lectures are engaging, but his classes suffer from significant organizational issues, including missing readings and assignments posted late or not at all, frequent cancellations, and poor communication through email. Students find his unpreparedness and frustration with students who are not equally prepared problematic, leading many to advise against taking his class.

Ratings.comment: Nice guy, enjoyable lectures, but my god he was disorganized.  Would assign readings that weren't on Carmen, class was cancelled due to outside circumstances a handful of times  I enjoyed the class and found subject interesting, but the structure of it all left some things to be desired
Matt is a nice guy, just kind of a flake. He would never put assignments, readings, or grades up on Carmen when he said he would. He also is HORRIBLE at responding to emails.

So if you have any questions about the class or your assignments, don't expect to hear back from him. He also never posts the readings or portals for discussions that he says he will. He doesn't come to class prepared and gets frustrated if you don't either even if you don't can't. He was kind of all over the place. 9/10 would not recommend.

summary_comment: Professor Aydogdu is highly regarded for her knowledge and passion for teaching, fostering engaging discussions and encouraging critical thinking. However, her classes are demanding, with extensive reading assignments and strict grading criteria. Students appreciate her clear expectations and structured approach, though some find the workload and anti-American sentiment in certain course materials challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Aydogdu is highly knowledgeable and passionate about her subject, fostering engaging discussions and encouraging critical thinking. However, her classes can be demanding in terms of reading and grading, and some students find them unsuitable for those seeking a more neutral or less challenging academic experience.

Ratings.comment: Zeynep is a great professor and is extremely knowledgable, kind, and respected. The class though, is not recommended for anyone who has pride in America. It had an anti-American sentiment and most assigned texts are biased towards how America is viewed. This is not Zeynep's fault, but should be warned before taking the class!

Zeynep was truly one of the best professors I've had thus far at this university. Not only did she provide lessons that showed how much thought and time she put into creating it, but she established a constructive environment that fostered really strong discussion.

I took this course for a GE credit and to balance out my challenging, upper division, courses for my major. Unfortunately, I made a huge mistake. This course was alot of reading for a GE 2000 level course. She would assign a new book every week. She was a strict grader took pts off for things that were not in her instructions/prompts.

I absolutely adored having her as a teacher. She is clearly passionate about what she teaches, which makes the class that much more interesting. We read a total of 6 novels for her class, and each one was interesting and thought-provoking. You're graded on participation and in-class discussion, and she encourages you to think for  yourself.

Professor Aydogdu has been one for my favorite college professors thus far. She clearly lays out what the class will be like and what you need to do to get an A, which turns out to be not much. The class is really interesting and actually changed my perspective on how I view the world. I'm so glad I took this class and  I recommend it to everyone!

summary_comment: Professor Batra-Wells is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching, earning strong recommendations from students. Her engaging and discussion-based approach, combined with her genuine care for her students' learning and comfort, makes her classes enjoyable and effective. Students appreciate her availability and clear explanations, though some note the lack of online grade tracking.
summary_comment_short: Professor Batra-Wells is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching, earning strong recommendations from students who find her approachable and caring. Her classes are described as engaging and discussion-based, with clear expectations and fair assignments that encourage thoughtful participation.

Ratings.comment: She's she sweetest ever! You can tell she really loves to teach and cares about her students. I originally had this class with another professor who was just awful and so I switched and it was the best decision! She is very helpful and will kindly answer any questions. WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Dr. Batra-Wells was one of the best teachers I have had at OSU! She is clearly passionate about what she is talking about. It is an easy A IF you come to class and participate. There is one midterm, two "papers" (2 pages max), and a final. The only complaint I have is that she does not use Carmen, so you don't know your grade until the end of the c

Excellent teacher who does a fantastic job facilitating engaging conversations relevant to the course material. Responds to emails in a timely fashion. Genuinely cares about the thoughts, learning, as well as comfort of students. Very relatable and easy to talk to. She is obviously very passionate and knowledgeable about the subject.

Dr. Puja Batra-Wells is my favorite professor I have ever had at Ohio State. She is very passionate about all of the material that she teaches. All of the assignments are fair and not too complicated, but they make you think about the readings and the discussions from class. I am taking another one of her classes next semester! Highly recommend!

Puja is super passionate about her stuff and teaches it so well. She adds in personal examples to help you understand it. There are a lot of lectures but more in class discussions so as long as you do the readings and participate you'll be fine for the tests. She doesn't let you have ANY electronics so you have to hand write notes.

She's clearly passionate about what she lectures. I found the class very enjoyable, and it is heavily discussion based. As long as you attend and participate in class discussions, you'll be fine on all the exams. You do have to read before every class, sometimes a lot, but it varies.

summary_comment: Professor Black is highly regarded for her engaging and interesting lectures, making complex material accessible and enjoyable. Students appreciate her kindness and care, though some find her lectures lengthy and prefer more interactive sessions. Overall, she is praised for her teaching quality and positive impact on students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Black is highly regarded for her engaging and interesting lectures, which many students find enjoyable and memorable. She is described as a caring and knowledgeable instructor who connects well with her students, though some note that her lectures can sometimes feel drawn out.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Black left OSU which is a real shame. I took Comp 2367 last year and wanted to take another class with her before I graduate. Her class was incredibly interesting and I liked the way she presented her lectures.

Black was extremely kind and caring. The course involves reading a ton of books, BUT there were no tests or assignments based on these readings... thus you technically do not need to read any of them (let's face it, no one in our class read any of them). There were 2 easy essays (the class average was a 90-something on both) and a group project.

This professor is very nice and knowledgable, but it is hard to sit in class and listen to the lecture for almost an hour and a half. The lecture could be done within 30-45 minutes but she draws it out way too long. She asks for class participation but would interrupt anyone who tried to talk. A kind person, but loves to hear herself talk.
I loved her class and always looked forward to going. She makes the material interesting and connects to students well. Also, quick with grading. All in all a real role model of an instructor.

Professor Black is a great teacher and even a better person. Would highly recommend to anyone that needs a credit in this area. Class is simply readings, three small papers, and one large 10 page paper that serves as the final. No exams or quizzes.

amazing teacher. Has so much cultural knowledge and experiences outside the US. takes attendance every class but going to class is fun. a lot of reading but most of the books are pretty interesting. 2 writing assignments, 1 final, and 1 group project. interesting class, but even more interesting teacher. would definitely take another class with her
Loved her. She cares about her students, gives interesting lectures, and is funny. The class is pretty easy, but you have to read a few books but they're fairly easy reads. Best professor ever.
Just the nicest lady ever. Take a class with her.

Now that I've graduated I can honestly say the class I took with Jennifer was the best of my college career. Passionate and compassionate, Jennifer truly shifted my paradigm and I've never looked at History, the media, pop culture or the news in the same way. Plus, honestly, her class and teaching style is straight-up fun.

Great teacher. really easy going and is extremely interested in everything she teaches its always fun to go to class she is very engaging and wants you to be also. Not a hard grader and just a fun and fair teacher. she teaches a bunch of classes too. I also had her for comparative studies 367

I loved having a class with Jennifer.  She is extremely nice and respectful to everyone in the class, and she doesn't make it too difficult.  She understands that it is more about making ideas comprehensible then dense.  Overall I would give her a grade of an A.
She is an AWESOME teacher! All of the topics studied were very interesting and she offered good insights to everything. Plus, she wants everyone to do well, so she does not grade very hard!

I had her for comparative studies 234, American Icons. This was a great, easy class. I recommend it for anyone interested in pop culture. The readings, although required were very interesting. Jennifer is a very fair, easy going teacher who is genuinely interested in helping her students. This was a great class and take it with Jennifer!

summary_comment: Professor Thorsteinsson (referred to as Vidar in comments) is known for assigning a significant amount of reading, with exams accounting for 70% of the grade and six pass/fail papers making up 24%. Students find the material interesting but note the high volume of reading required. The class structure allows some flexibility with attendance and reading assignments, though consistent engagement is crucial for success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thorsteinsson (referred to as Vidar in comments) is known for assigning substantial reading, with exams accounting for 70% of the grade and six pass/fail papers making up 24%. Students find the material interesting but note the high volume of reading and frequent, brief writing assignments. Overall, the class is demanding, with mandatory attendance and strict requirements for passing.

Ratings.comment: Lots of effort reading for not really tough grading but had to read some becuase of "familiarity questions" on exams. Tons of reading. 6, 1500 word papers (24% of final) where the prompt is "pick and quote and tell me why you picked it" they are P/F, then 6% for coming to class, then 70% from the midterm and final (35% each) easy A if you read

Vidar is a pretty good teacher. You get assigned books to read, 2 were interesting and 2 were not at all. Didn't read all of them and only missed 4 points the entire semester. Papers are based on your opinion and how you want to go about writing them but be prepared for 2 page papers pretty much every 2 weeks. Class is mandatory

This class is a ton of reading, but the material was very interesting. Vidar is a very smart professor and he tells you exactly what's going to be on the tests (2 for 70%). However, if you don't read, you'll fail the tests. The reading responses are you're own commentary and they are P/F so those are pretty easy.

70% of the class is exams 24% of the class is 6 papers that are 4% of your final score (all are pass/fail basis) 6% is group work occasionally  You can skip 2 days throughout the semester no questions asked, but  you have to get 4 reading books.   This is my first time using Rate My Professor, because I didn't like this class at all.

summary_comment: Professor Hendy is highly regarded for her engaging and entertaining lectures that help students understand course material, making even complex topics accessible. Students appreciate her thoughtful approach and respect for their learning needs, though some note that attendance in recitations is crucial for full understanding and participation points. Overall, her teaching is effective and enjoyable, with many students expressing a willingness to take her classes again.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hendy is highly regarded for her engaging and effective teaching methods, making complex topics accessible and interesting. Her lectures are detailed and helpful for understanding course materials, though some students find they need to attend recitations and read assigned materials thoroughly to fully grasp the content.

Ratings.comment: The t.a's grade everything she does nothing but lecture. she wouldnt round my grade but at the last minute of the new semester i got an email and my grade got rounded.... not sure if it was her
Professor Hendy was a great teacher and kept class fun and entertaining as well as relevant.
Loved the class. Very nice prof, makes boring stuff really interesting.
Prof Hendy is a great teacher. Her lectures me understand the readings. She's thoughtful and respects students. I'll take her class again!
Lectures were great and helped to understand the readings. Prof. Hendy was helpful and gave really good comments when I talked to her in office hours. Loved this class!

Only one midterm and one final. MUST go to recitation or you don't get participation points at all. Her lectures were interesting but if you didn't go to class and listen to what she lectured about some of the stuff didn't make sense if you just tried to look it up. MUST read if you wanna pass, tons of online readings and books assigned.
Talks like she's constantly reading out of a peer reviewed journal.  Zero laymen speak, B.S. class.

summary_comment: Professor Sikdar is an effective teacher who simplifies complex concepts for easier understanding and provides useful homework. However, lectures can be枯燥无味，而项目则较为有趣且易于完成，但部分测验和考试难度不一。
summary_comment_short: Professor Sikdar is an effective teacher who simplifies complex concepts and provides useful homework assignments. However, lectures can be枯燥乏味，而项目则较为有趣且难度适中，部分测验和考试难度不一。

Ratings.comment: I thought she was a really good teacher. The concepts were abstract but she was able to put into terms that were easy to understand and the homework helps learn as well. She's also kind and supportive in office hours!
Lectures were pretty boring. The projects were interesting and fairly straightforward. Some of our quizzes and tests were easy, others were tougher.

summary_comment: Professor Maymind is highly regarded for her passion and expertise in religious studies, consistently providing supportive and engaging classroom environments. Students appreciate her availability and willingness to assist outside of class, though some note the heavy reading load, especially in writing-intensive courses. Her classes are described as intellectually stimulating and well-organized, fostering a supportive and open-minded atmosphere for discussion.
summary_comment_short: Professor Maymind is highly regarded for her passion and dedication to teaching, providing extensive support both in and out of class, and fostering a comfortable environment for discussion. Students appreciate her knowledge and commitment to her students' success, though some note the heavy reading load, particularly in newer semester formats.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Maymind is the best professor I've had at OSU. She knows students take her class for GE credit but this doesn't deter her. She is passionate about what she teaches and is so helpful in and out of class. I am interested in taking more religious studies courses after her class. She expects strong writing but provides plenty of resources for help

Prof. Maymind is an extremely nice person and always willing to help and send as many emails outside of class as it takes for you to understand the material.  The problem is that (at least during the switch to semesters) there is an extreme amount of reading, especially in a course meant for writing, and more was added on as the class continued.

She is a fantastic teacher; she knows her stuff and thoroughly enjoys teaching. Funny too! It is very, very busy, having to read so much all the time, but if you do the work it isn't terribly hard. Also, attendance isn't completely mandatory, but it helps to take for writing the papers later, and you need participation points.

Comparative Studies 367.03 was an easy A and if you are interested in studying religion and reading articles based on views of religion this class is for you. The only thing is attendance is mandatory and there is a LOT of reading. 2 short papers, reading summaries each week, and 1 final paper is what makes your grade. I recommend this professor!!
I loved this class! Ilana is awesome! Very knowledgable and very approachable. Really cares about the students and knows her stuff!

She is my favorite teacher I've had so far at OSU. She really cares about her students and responds to e-mails quickly. She's also very open minded and provides a comfortable environment for discussion.

Ilana is a great teacher. Knowledgeable and invested in students' success. Reading were interesting and there were always questions for readings posted to make these readings more focused. Also, always had supplementary materials posted according to students' interests. Provided for a comfortable atmosphere for discussion.
Interesting course, she never really adds much to the conversation, leaves it up to students. Seems kind of scatterbrained
Intellectually stimulating!

Could not stand her...she's very closed minded and does not allow you to have an opinion...condescending...her presence in the classroom is pointless because she adds very little to the conversation...NOT RECOMMENDED!!!!!

Basically, scatterbrained. Discussions were pointless. She just asked a question and relied on the class to just take it away. Never had an opinion to offer. Class was like pulling teeth. But I got through the course with an A. Disappointed because the topics were interesting but discussions did not relate well to lectures.

Very nice lady. She's a very helpful TA. Always responds to e-mails. Very helpful in answering questions. Gives great reviews before midterm. Very easy grader and nice grader. Does not make you do quizzes instead she gives cl**** discussions of what is going on in lecture. Take her as your TA if you can.

summary_comment: Professor Coleman is a highly intelligent and engaging scholar who is praised for his precise definitions and deep understanding of complex concepts. However, his lectures are often criticized for being overly verbose, making it difficult for students to grasp the material without additional study.
summary_comment_short: Professor Coleman is a highly intelligent and engaging lecturer who defines terms meticulously, which some find challenging due to his complex explanations. While appreciated by those who value precision and depth, his lectures are criticized for being overly detailed and difficult to follow, leaving some students feeling they learn little despite attending regularly.

Ratings.comment: He's too wordy and doesn't know how to dumb the topics down enough to clarify what the hell is going on in lecture. I sat in class for almost 2hrs twice a week an learned nothing.

What a great scholar. I loved this class. Attracts an interesting, intellectual group. Professor Coleman is so smart, speaks wonderfully and I like that he takes time to define the terms he using, forcing students to be precise when using famous concepts like commodity fetishism or even neoliberalism. Very engaging, very intellectual, great work.
